text: Arthur Mitchell (March 27, 1934 - September 19, 2018) was an African-American dancer and choreographer. He created a training school and the first African- American classical ballet company, Dance Theatre of Harlem (DTH). Mitchell was recognized as a MacArthur Fellow. He was added into the National Museum of Dance's Mr. & Mrs. Cornelius Vanderbilt Whitney Hall of Fame, and received the United States National Medal of Arts. Mitchell died on September 19, 2018 in Manhattan from heart failure at the age of 84.Arthur Mitchell Is Dead at 84; Showed the Way for Black Dancers ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:American dancers Category:LGBT dancers Category:Gay men Category:LGBT African-Americans Category:African-American writers Category:American choreographers Category:LGBT people from New York City Category:Writers from New York City
title: Arthur Mitchell (dancer)
